Description: SysBio VEOIBD Clinical Metadata template schema
ID used for sharing amongst consortium. formatted as [site prefix] + [localID]
local ID used for subject by study site
site at which the participant was recruited
role of the study participant within the family group
if participantRole=sibling, specify sibling type
biological sex of the study participant
study participant age at diagnosis
age at diagnosis unit
VEOIBD phenotype code indicating the GI diagnosis
does the study participant have an immunodeficiency diagnosis
does the study participant have a known autoimmune condition
please specify which autoimmune disease the participant has, if any
location of GI disease or activity pertinent to VEOIBD study
Valid Values: L1, L1. Ileal ,L2, L2. Colonic ,L3, L3. Ileocolonic ,L4, L4*. Isolated upper disease ,E1, E1. Ulcerative proctitis ,E2, E2. Left-sided uc ,E3, E3. Extensive ,E4, E4. Pancolitis

Description: if LocationOfDiseaseActivity=upper disease, please specify
Valid Values: L4a, L4a. Upper disease proximal to ligament of treitz ,L4b, L4b. Upper disease distal to ligament of treitz & proximal to distal 3rd ileum

Description: Behavior of GI disease
Valid Values: Non-stricturing and non-penetrating ,Stricturing ,Penetrating ,Both penetrating and stricturing ,Never severe ,Ever severe (â‰¥65 PUCAI)

Description: has the study participant experienced growth delay
is there perianal involvement
is there a history of extraintestinal manifestations
has the study participant undergone any GI surgeries
please specify which GI surgeries the participant has undergone, if any
does the study participant have a family history of IBD
study participant country of birth
Valid Values: see data dictionary for full list of values

Description: is the study participant the offspring of a relationship between biologically-related individuals
study participant race
Valid Values: White , Black or African American , Asian , American Indian or Alaskan Native , Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander , Unknown or Not Reported

Description: study participant ethnicity
is study participant of Jewish origin
was study participant breastfed
if study participant was breastfed, what was the duration of breastfeeding in months
was the study participant exposed to second hand smoke in the period 6 months prior to diagnosis
SysBio VEOIBD Biospecimen template schema
local ID used for subject by study site
ID used for sharing amongst consortia members. Formatted as [site prefix] + [local Subject id]
Meaningful ID used for identifying samples.  For RC2 Samples: formatted as [IndividualID] + [Sample Type Abbreviation] + [Sample letter key] + [Subcategory of analysis type]

Key indicating additional information about samples. Should match key found in RC2 Sample ID
For biopsy: suggested location, inflammation status, and preservation method. 
For Blood: blood component, preservation method
Funding source used to support sampling. May be necessary information to determine scope of sharing permissions
Indicates type of sample being described
Biopsy actual location (may differ from suggested location)
Valid Values: Sigmoid, Descending Colon/Transverse, Sigmoid/Descending Colon, Unspecified, Ascending, Ileum, Rectum, Secum, Transverse Colon, Most Severe Area

Description: Biopsy inflammation status
number of biopsies
method of preservation for biopsy samples
Valid Values: cryopreserved, snap frozen, formalin, PAXgene tube

Description: volume of serum, PBMC, PAX collected
units the volume is reported in
number of cells for PBMC samples as # x 10^6
cell viability for PBMC samples
date sample was collected in format YYYY-MM-DD
general diagnosis category
any additional notes about the biospecimen
tracking number issued by vendor. this can be used to identify shipping "batches" i.e. samples that were shipped at the same time under the same conditions
vendor used to ship biosamples
sample originator. Should match prefix on RC2 Sample ID
unique ID, if there is one that is separate from the specimen ID (for example, if sites use their own internal unique ID).  Some sites may collect this but not all
SysBio VEOIBD Bulk RNAseq template schema
Library ID as provided by the lab
The technology used to generate the data in this file
ID of the protocol used in storing, preparing, and analyzing this data
The nucleotide sequence of the sample barcode used to identify cells from a single sample in cell hashing or multiplexing assays.
RNA Integrity Number
Batch in which RNA sample was isolated
technology used to isolate the RNA
Batch library was prepared in
Batch library was sequenced in
Total number of sequencing reads from a library
Fraction of reads with cell barcodes that match the whitelist
Number of cells or nuclei sequenced
The median number of genes detected (with nonzero UMI counts) across all cell-associated barcodes
Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software
The processing level of the data
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally.
Ratio of absorbance at 230 nm and 260 nm. Measures protein or other contaminants. Range up to approximately 2.2.
Measure of DNA vs. RNA purity. Range up to approximately 2.0.
The number of unique genes
Mapped reads refer to those reads from the sequenced sample that align directly to a single region (set of loci) on the reference genome.
The percentage of rRNA in a cell
The total number of unmapped reads from the sequenced sample to a single region (set of loci) on the reference genome.
Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines
kit serial number
The DV200 is the percentage of RNA fragments > 200 nucleotides.
SysBio VEOIBD Single Cell RNAseq template schema
The technology used to generate the data in this file
The nucleotide sequence of the sample barcode used to identify cells from a single sample in cell hashing or multiplexing assays.
ID of the protocol used in storing, preparing, and analyzing this data
Library ID as provided by the lab
A set of references (e.g., canonical assembled contigs) which defines a common coordinate space for comparing reference-aligned experimental data.
Batch in which RNA sample was isolated
technology used to isolate the RNA
Batch library was prepared in
Total number of sequencing reads from a library
Fraction of reads with cell barcodes that match the whitelist
Number of cells or nuclei sequenced
The median number of genes detected (with nonzero UMI counts) across all cell-associated barcodes
The median number of total Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) counts across all cell-associated barcodes
Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software
The processing level of the data
A cell phenotype that consists of the cell's disposition to survive and develop normally.
Percent mitochondria per cell
The number of unique genes
Mapped reads refer to those reads from the sequenced sample that align directly to a single region (set of loci) on the reference genome.
The percentage of rRNA in a cell
Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines
kit serial number
The DV200 is the percentage of RNA fragments > 200 nucleotides.
The duplication rate is the fraction of mapped reads where any 2 reads share the same 5â€² and 3â€² coordinates.
SysBio VEOIBD Organoid template schema
DependsOn: individualID,specimenID,Site,OrganoidID,Region,Inflammation Status,Growth,Phenotype,Size,Gene mutation,Response after 6h exposure,Response after 72h exposure,Grew at Clevers

Description: Unique identifier linked to the organoid being described
Region being modeled by organoid
descriptor of the growth pattern observed in the organoid
organoid observed phenotype
Valid Values: Cystic,Tend to fold,Tend to die,Fibrotic,Folded CF-likeThin walls,Normal,Thick walls,Forming dead masses,

Description: size of the organoid
gene of interest

Valid Values: Yes,No growth,Infected,Infected upon arrival,No,No Stopped after P3,Normal,Normal/Apoptosis,Slow,Stopped growing
